newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - Sept 24.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post business - Sept 24.

text.p: The Washington Post carries the following items on the front page of its business section on Sept. 24:
WASHINGTON - Republican presidential candidate Bob Dole has not culled many benefits from the tax cut proposal that was to be the centerpiece of his campaign.
WASHINGTON - Bell Atlantic Corp. will begin distributing Yellow Pages directories that contain listings for Montgomery County and Prince George's County in one volume.

WASHINGTON - The Securities and Exchange Commission accused the former chairman of Tyson Foods Inc. of tipping off a friend who then made a quick profit in the stock of a company that Tyson was planning to acquire.

PALO ALTO, CALIFORNIA - Entrepeneurs are worried about a California referendum item that aims to make it easier for investors to sue companies and their executives for misrepresenting their companies' financial health.
